trans-unit.source: How to use Shared Access Signature Authentication with Service Bus
trans-unit.target: How to use Shared Access Signature Authentication with Service Bus

trans-unit.source: This section describes how to use the Shared Access Signature (SAS) authentication model with <token>sb1</token>.
trans-unit.target: This section describes how to use the Shared Access Signature (SAS) authentication model with <token>sb1</token>.

trans-unit.source: The samples shown here are written in C# and use the Azure SDK libraries.
trans-unit.target: The samples shown here are written in C# and use the Azure SDK libraries.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios include configuration of authorization rules, generation of SAS tokens, and client authorization.
trans-unit.target: The scenarios include configuration of authorization rules, generation of SAS tokens, and client authorization.

trans-unit.source: For a full working sample of a <token>sb2</token> application that illustrates the configuration and uses SAS authorization, see <externalLink><linkText>Shared Access Signature authentication with Service Bus</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Shared-Access-Signature-0a88adf8</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For a full working sample of a <token>sb2</token> application that illustrates the configuration and uses SAS authorization, see <externalLink><linkText>Shared Access Signature authentication with Service Bus</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Shared-Access-Signature-0a88adf8</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: A related sample that illustrates the use of SAS authorization rules configured on namespaces or topics to secure <token>sb2</token> subscriptions is available here: <externalLink><linkText>Using Shared Access Signature (SAS) authentication with Service Bus Subscriptions</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Using-Shared-Access-e605b37c</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: A related sample that illustrates the use of SAS authorization rules configured on namespaces or topics to secure <token>sb2</token> subscriptions is available here: <externalLink><linkText>Using Shared Access Signature (SAS) authentication with Service Bus Subscriptions</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Using-Shared-Access-e605b37c</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Accessing Shared Access Authorization Rules on a Namespace
trans-unit.target: Accessing Shared Access Authorization Rules on a Namespace

trans-unit.source: Operations on the <token>sb2</token> namespace root require certificate authentication.
trans-unit.target: Operations on the <token>sb2</token> namespace root require certificate authentication.

trans-unit.source: You must upload a management certificate for your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: You must upload a management certificate for your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: To upload a management certificate, click <ui>Settings</ui> in the left-hand pane of the management portal.
trans-unit.target: To upload a management certificate, click <ui>Settings</ui> in the left-hand pane of the management portal.

trans-unit.source: <token>crabout</token> Azure management certificates, see <externalLink><linkText>Create a Management Certificate for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg551722.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crabout</token> Azure management certificates, see <externalLink><linkText>Create a Management Certificate for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/gg551722.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The endpoint for accessing shared access authorization rules on a <token>sb2</token> namespace is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The endpoint for accessing shared access authorization rules on a <token>sb2</token> namespace is as follows:

trans-unit.source: To create a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> object on a <token>sb2</token> namespace, execute a POST operation on this endpoint with the rule information serialized as JSON or XML.
trans-unit.target: To create a <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> object on a <token>sb2</token> namespace, execute a POST operation on this endpoint with the rule information serialized as JSON or XML.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Similarly, use a GET operation on the endpoint to read the authorization rules configured on the namespace.
trans-unit.target: Similarly, use a GET operation on the endpoint to read the authorization rules configured on the namespace.

trans-unit.source: To update or delete a specific authorization rule, use the following endpoint:
trans-unit.target: To update or delete a specific authorization rule, use the following endpoint:

trans-unit.source: Accessing Shared Access Authorization Rules on an Entity
trans-unit.target: Accessing Shared Access Authorization Rules on an Entity

trans-unit.source: You can access a <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> object configured on a <token>sb2</token> queue or topic through the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.AuthorizationRules</codeEntityReference> collection in the corresponding <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription</codeEntityReference>, <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.TopicDescription</codeEntityReference>, or <codeEntityReference autoUpgrade="true" qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Notifications.NotificationHubDescription</codeEntityReference> objects.
trans-unit.target: You can access a <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.SharedAccessAuthorizationRule</codeEntityReference> object configured on a <token>sb2</token> queue or topic through the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.AuthorizationRules</codeEntityReference> collection in the corresponding <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.QueueDescription</codeEntityReference>, <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.TopicDescription</codeEntityReference>, or <codeEntityReference autoUpgrade="true" qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Notifications.NotificationHubDescription</codeEntityReference> objects.

trans-unit.source: The following code shows how to add authorization rules for a queue.
trans-unit.target: The following code shows how to add authorization rules for a queue.

trans-unit.source: Using Shared Access Signature Authorization
trans-unit.target: Using Shared Access Signature Authorization

trans-unit.source: Applications using the Azure .NET SDK with the <token>sb2</token> .NET libraries can use SAS authorization through the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.SharedAccessSignatureTokenProvider</codeEntityReference> class.
trans-unit.target: Applications using the Azure .NET SDK with the <token>sb2</token> .NET libraries can use SAS authorization through the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.SharedAccessSignatureTokenProvider</codeEntityReference> class.

trans-unit.source: The following code illustrates the use of the token provider to send messages to a <token>sb2</token> queue.
trans-unit.target: The following code illustrates the use of the token provider to send messages to a <token>sb2</token> queue.

trans-unit.source: Applications can also use SAS for authentication by using a SAS connection string in methods that accept connection strings.
trans-unit.target: Applications can also use SAS for authentication by using a SAS connection string in methods that accept connection strings.

trans-unit.source: Note that to use SAS authorization with <token>sb2</token> relays, you can use SAS keys configured on the <token>sb2</token> namespace.
trans-unit.target: Note that to use SAS authorization with <token>sb2</token> relays, you can use SAS keys configured on the <token>sb2</token> namespace.

trans-unit.source: If you explicitly create a relay on the namespace (<codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NamespaceManager</codeEntityReference> with a <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.RelayDescription</codeEntityReference>) object, you can set the SAS rules just for that relay.
trans-unit.target: If you explicitly create a relay on the namespace (<codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.NamespaceManager</codeEntityReference> with a <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.RelayDescription</codeEntityReference>) object, you can set the SAS rules just for that relay.

trans-unit.source: To use SAS authorization with <token>sb2</token> subscriptions, you can use SAS keys configured on a <token>sb2</token> namespace or on a topic.
trans-unit.target: To use SAS authorization with <token>sb2</token> subscriptions, you can use SAS keys configured on a <token>sb2</token> namespace or on a topic.
